match.subtitle: We could do it, you know?
match.quote: We could do it, you know,

match.subtitle: Take off, live in the woods.
match.quote: Run off.

match.subtitle: Take off, live in the woods.
match.quote: Live in the woods.

match.subtitle: I'm never having kids.
match.quote: I never want to have kids,

match.subtitle: I might, if I didn't live here.
match.quote: I might.

match.subtitle: I might, if I didn't live here.
match.quote: If I didn't live here,

match.subtitle: But you do live here.
match.quote: But you do,

match.subtitle: Cost me a squirrel.
match.quote: Just a squirrel.

match.subtitle: Happy Hunger Games.
match.quote: Happy Hunger Games!

match.subtitle: And may the odds be ever in your favor.
match.quote: And may the odds—

match.subtitle: And may the odds be ever in your favor.
match.quote: —be ever in your favor!

match.subtitle: You look beautiful.
match.quote: You look beautiful,

match.subtitle: But you better tuck in that tail, little duck.
match.quote: Tuck your tail in, little duck,

match.subtitle: Happy Hunger Games.
match.quote: Happy Hunger Games!

match.subtitle: And may the odds be ever in your favor.
match.quote: And may the odds be ever in your favor

match.subtitle: As usual, ladies first.
match.quote: Ladies first!

match.subtitle: I volunteer as Tribute!
match.quote: I volunteer as tribute!

match.subtitle: Bring her up.
match.quote: Let her come forward.

match.subtitle: What's your name?
match.quote: What's your name?

match.subtitle: Katniss Everdeen.
match.quote: Katniss Everdeen,

match.subtitle: Well, I bet my hat that was your sister, wasn't it?
match.quote: I bet my buttons that was your sister.

match.subtitle: Let's have a big hand for our very first volunteer, Katniss Everdeen.
match.quote: Let's give a big round of applause to our newest tribute!

match.subtitle: And now for the boys.
match.quote: It's time to choose our boy tribute!

match.subtitle: Peeta Mellark.
match.quote: Peeta Mellark.

match.subtitle: Maybe you can.
match.quote: Maybe you can win.

match.subtitle: You can't tune out again.
match.quote: You can't leave again,

match.subtitle: I won't.
match.quote: I won't.

match.subtitle: I won't be there anymore.
match.quote: There's no me now to keep you both alive.

match.subtitle: Get to a bow.
match.quote: Getting a knife should be pretty easy, but you've got to get your hands on a bow.

match.subtitle: They may not have...
match.quote: They don't always have bows,

match.subtitle: If they don't have a bow, then you make one, okay?
match.quote: Then make one,

match.subtitle: You know how to hunt.
match.quote: You know how to kill.

match.subtitle: It's no different, Katniss.
match.quote: How different can it be, really?

match.subtitle: Whatever you do, don't let them starve.
match.quote: Don't let them starve!

match.subtitle: My name's Cinna.
match.quote: I'm Cinna, your stylist,

match.subtitle: Now, usually they dress people in the clothes from their district.
match.quote: As you know, it's customary to reflect the flavor of the district.

match.subtitle: Yeah, we're always coalminers.
match.quote: So, I'll be in a coal miner outfit?

match.subtitle: Okay, this is safe.
match.quote: You'll be perfectly safe,

match.subtitle: It's not real fire.
match.quote: It's not real flame, of course, just a little synthetic fire Portia and I came up with.

match.subtitle: Are you sure you should be near an open flame?
match.quote: With all that alcohol in him, it's probably not advisable to have him around an open flame,

match.subtitle: My father buys her squirrels.
match.quote: My father buys her squirrels.

match.subtitle: He says she hits them right in the eye every time.
match.quote: She hits every one in the eye.

match.subtitle: He can throw a 100-pound sack of flour right over his head.
match.quote: You can lift hundredpound bags of flour,

match.subtitle: I've seen it.
match.quote: I've seen you in the market.

match.subtitle: You know what my mother said?
match.quote: You know what my mother said to me when she came to say good-bye, as if to cheer me up, she says maybe District Twelve will finally have a winner.

match.subtitle: She said District 12 might finally have a winner.
match.quote: You know what my mother said to me when she came to say good-bye, as if to cheer me up, she says maybe District Twelve will finally have a winner.

match.subtitle: She was talking about you.
match.quote: Then I realized, she didn't mean me, she meant you!

match.subtitle: Hey, I think you have a shadow.
match.quote: I think we have a shadow.

match.subtitle: Shoot straight.
match.quote: You... shoot straight.

match.subtitle: Thank you for your consideration.
match.quote: Thank you for your consideration,

match.subtitle: He says he wants to be trained on his own from now on.
match.quote: Peeta has asked to be coached separately.

match.subtitle: Just be yourself, I'll be there the whole time.
match.quote: Why don't you just be yourself?

match.subtitle: When you came out of that chariot, I have to say, my heart stopped.
match.quote: When you came out in the opening ceremonies, my heart actually stopped.

match.subtitle: We were all very moved, I think, when you volunteered for her at the Reaping.
match.quote: Let's go back then, to the moment they called your sister's name at the reaping,

match.subtitle: We were all very moved, I think, when you volunteered for her at the Reaping.
match.quote: And you volunteered.

match.subtitle: And what did you say to her in the end?
match.quote: What did she say to you?

match.subtitle: I told her that I would try to win.
match.quote: She asked me to try really hard to win.

match.subtitle: That I would try to win for her.
match.quote: I swore I would.

match.subtitle: Of course you did.
match.quote: I bet you did,

match.subtitle: Ladies and gentlemen, from District 12, Katniss Everdeen, The Girl on Fire!
match.quote: Best of luck, Katniss Everdeen, tribute from District Twelve.

match.subtitle: Do I smell like roses to you?
match.quote: Tell me, do I still smell like roses?

match.subtitle: So, Peeta, tell me, is there a special girl back home?
match.quote: There must be some special girl.

match.subtitle: Handsome man like you.
match.quote: Handsome lad like you.

match.subtitle: There is this one girl that I've had a crush on forever.
match.quote: Well, there is this one girl.

match.subtitle: There is this one girl that Ive had a crush on forever
match.quote: I've had a crush on her ever since I can remember.

match.subtitle: But I don't think she actually recognized me until the Reaping.
match.quote: But I'm pretty sure she didn't know I was alive until the reaping.

match.subtitle: You go out there and you win this thing, and when you get home, she'll have to go out with you.
match.quote: You win, you go home.

match.subtitle: You go out there and you win this thing, and when you get home, she'll have to go out with you.
match.quote: She can't turn you down then, eh?

match.subtitle: Thanks, but I don't think winning's gonna help me at all.
match.quote: Winning... won't help in my case,

match.subtitle: And why not?
match.quote: Why ever not?

match.subtitle: Because she came here with me.
match.quote: Because... because... she came here with me.

match.subtitle: Well, that's bad luck.
match.quote: Oh, that is a piece of bad luck,

match.subtitle: And I wish you all the best of luck.
match.quote: Well, best of luck to you, Peeta Mellark, and I think I speak for all of Panem when I say our hearts go with yours.

match.subtitle: Thank you.
match.quote: Thank you

match.subtitle: What the hell was that?
match.quote: What was that for?

match.subtitle: He made me look weak.
match.quote: He made me look weak!

match.subtitle: He made you look desirable, which in your case, can't hurt, sweetheart.
match.quote: He made you look desirable!

match.subtitle: Now, I can sell the star-crossed lovers from District 12...
match.quote: The star-crossed lovers from District Twelve!

match.subtitle: We are not star-crossed lovers.
match.quote: But we're not star-crossed lovers!

match.subtitle: It's a television show!
match.quote: It's all a big show.

match.subtitle: Can't sleep?
match.quote: Couldn't sleep, either?

match.subtitle: No.
match.quote: No,

match.subtitle: I just don't want them to change me.
match.quote: I don't want them to change me in there.

match.subtitle: They'd turn me into something I'm not.
match.quote: Turn me into some kind of monster that I'm not.

match.subtitle: I just don't want to be another piece in their game, you know?
match.quote: That I'm more than just a piece in their Games,

match.subtitle: You mean you won't kill anyone?
match.quote: Do you mean you won't kill anyone?

match.subtitle: I mean, I'm sure I would, just like anybody else when the time came, but I just keep wishing that I could think of a way to show them that they don't own me.
match.quote: No, when the time comes, I'm sure I'll kill just like everybody else.

match.subtitle: I mean, I'm sure I would, just like anybody else when the time came, but I just keep wishing that I could think of a way to show them that they don't own me.
match.quote: Only I keep wishing I could think of a way to... to show the Capitol they don't own me.

match.subtitle: If I'm gonna die, I want to still be me.
match.quote: Only... I want to die as myself.

match.subtitle: Does that make any sense?
match.quote: Does that make any sense?

match.subtitle: It's a bloodbath.
match.quote: You're neither of you up to the blood bath at the Cornucopia.

match.subtitle: You turn, run, find high ground, look for water.
match.quote: Just clear out, put as much distance as you can between yourselves and the others, and find a source of water,

match.subtitle: I'm not allowed to bet, but if I could, I'd bet on you.
match.quote: I'm not allowed to bet, but if I could, my money would be on you.

match.subtitle: Hey, lover boy!
match.quote: Go on, then, Lover Boy,

match.subtitle: Are you sure we shouldn't just kill him now?
match.quote: Why don't we just kill him now and get it over with?

match.subtitle: He's our best chance of finding her.
match.quote: Besides, he's our best chance of finding her.

match.subtitle: How long was I asleep?
match.quote: How many nights did I miss?

match.subtitle: And the boy from my district?
match.quote: You know the boy from my district?

match.subtitle: They got all their supplies down by the lake.
match.quote: But they've got everything down by the lake,

match.subtitle: Okay, so if we hear that, it means we're okay and we'll be back real soon.
match.quote: But if you hear the mockingjays singing it, you'll know I'm okay, only I can't get back right away.

match.subtitle: Hey, I'll see you for supper.
match.quote: If all goes according to plan, I'll see you for dinner,

match.subtitle: It seems they've reburied their mines around that big pile of goodies.
match.quote: It's mined,

match.subtitle: Did you blow up the food?
match.quote: You blew up the food?

match.subtitle: Every bit of it.
match.quote: Every last bit,

match.subtitle: You have to win.
match.quote: You have to win,

match.subtitle: Can you sing?
match.quote: Sing,

match.subtitle: Soup.
match.quote: I'm going to make you soup,

match.subtitle: Your hair was in two braids instead of one.
match.quote: You had on a red plaid dress and your hair... it was in two braids instead of one.

match.subtitle: And I remember when you sang in the music assembly.
match.quote: So that day, in music assembly, the teacher asked who knew the valley song.

match.subtitle: The teacher said, “Who knows The Valley Song?
match.quote: So that day, in music assembly, the teacher asked who knew the valley song.

match.subtitle: And your hand shot straight up.
match.quote: Your hand shot right up in the air.

match.subtitle: Each of you needs something desperately.
match.quote: Each of you needs something desperately.

match.subtitle: What was her name again?
match.quote: Just like we did your pathetic little ally... what was her name?

match.subtitle: Rue?
match.quote: Rue?

match.subtitle: Peeta, I got it.
match.quote: Peeta.

match.subtitle: You're so much better.
match.quote: You're better,

match.subtitle: You're so much better.
match.quote: Much better.

match.subtitle: That's Nightlock, Peeta!
match.quote: They're nightlock.

match.subtitle: You'd be dead in a minute!
match.quote: You'll be dead before they reach your stomach.

match.subtitle: She's clever.
match.quote: And she's very clever, Peeta.

match.subtitle: The previous revision, allowing for two victors from the same district, has been revoked.
match.quote: The earlier revision has been revoked.

match.subtitle: Only one victor may be crowned.
match.quote: Closer examination of the rule book has disclosed that only one winner may be allowed,

match.subtitle: Good luck.
match.quote: Good luck and may the odds be ever in your favor.

match.subtitle: And may the odds be ever in your favor.
match.quote: Good luck and may the odds be ever in your favor

match.subtitle: They have to have their victor.
match.quote: We both know they have to have a victor.

match.subtitle: One...
match.quote: One.

match.subtitle: Two...
match.quote: Two.

match.subtitle: Three.
match.quote: Three!

match.subtitle: Ladies and gentlemen, may I present the winners of the 74th Annual Hunger Games.
match.quote: Ladies and gentlemen, I am pleased to present the victors of the Seventy-fourth Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark!

match.subtitle: They're not happy with you.
match.quote: Word is the Capitol's furious about you showing them up in the arena.

match.subtitle: You were so in love with this boy that the thought of not being with him was unthinkable.
match.quote: Your only defense can be you were so madly in love you weren't responsible for your actions.

match.subtitle: I don't know.
match.quote: I don't know.
